translations: n．隆隆声，轰鸣声：持续的低沉声音，通常表示不满、抱怨或某种活动的预兆。
· There were rumblings of discontent among the workers.
工人们发出了不满的抱怨声。

sentences.sentence: There are rumblings that the election may have to be postponed.
sentences.translation: 有传言说选举也许不得不延期。

sentences.sentence: Even Baldwin had become aware that there were rumblings of discontent within the ranks.
sentences.translation: 就连鲍德温也开始意识到内部成员有不满的迹象。

sentences.sentence: We think our perceptions of the world are real, but they are only biological and electrical rumblings.
sentences.translation: 我们认为我们对世界的感知是真实的，但它们只是生物和电器的声音。
